main event: Observers watched three flashing lights for an extended period, however, after observing them for a time, they concluded that the objects were ordinary night lights and their flashing was due to their distance and hazy atmospheric conditions.
interesting points: The observers watched the three flashing lights for 1 hour.
The objects were stationary in the sky at an elevation of 50 degrees.
The observers concluded the objects were ordinary night lights and not extraordinary.
There was no physical evidence of the objects.
The observers lacked further evidence to determine the identity of the objects.
